question: What source applications support Password Interception?
Which option describes 'Zero Knowledge Encryption' as used by IdentityNow?

options.answer: An administrator specifies a passphrase to generate a 2048-bit RSA public/private key pair that is used by the virtual appliance to secure communications.
Each cluster may have its own unique user-assigned passphrase, and multiple clusters may be deployed to meet the distributed needs of a security model.
Software and app credentials are secured in a way that separates the key from encrypted data so that even SailPoint cannot decrypt customers’ data.

question: The Scale benefits of the IdentityNow Microservices are:

options.answer: IdentityNow Microservices are dependent so they scale by elastically starting a few number of API calls and limiting the number of resources it spins up.
IdentityNow Microservices are dependent so they scale by using other parts of the platform to spin up dynamic resources.
IdentityNow Microservices independently and elastically scale in real time to work in a singular unified direction for overall optimization.
IdentityNow Microservices independently and elastically scale in real time so usage can scale on demand and balance across dynamic resources.

question: It is recommended that you use a different key passphrase for all VAs across your installation.
How many IdentityNow Environments will each customer get unless they have purchased additional Environments?
The use of Static IP Addresses for the VA's prevents networking setup and monitoring.
How many VA's should be deployed in a Production IdentityNow Environment?
The Governance process includes:
If you need to run a non-optimized aggregation from a source, you can only configure this via the API.
The Agility benefits of the IdentityNow Microservices are:

options.answer: Larger services (code bases) mean faster delivery of new features and code updates.
Smaller services (code bases) less frequent delivery of new features and code updates.
When a change is made, if something isn’t working as expected, the changes are automatically prevented.
When a change is made, you immediately know if something isn’t working as expected, and simply rollback that change.

question: Access Profiles can contain Entitlements from different Sources.
What does VA stand for?
What is the Purpose of the VA?

options.answer: The VA is installed in the cloud, and its job is to check the health of IdentityNow, generate a log, and send notifications when resources stall.
The VA is installed in the cloud, and its job is to communicate updates to the IdentityNow tenant, and send notifications to administrators.
The VA is installed in the customer's environment, inside the firewall, and its job is to call out to IdentityNow for any jobs/tasks to be executed.
The VA is installed in the customer's environment, inside the firewall, and its job is to receive IdentityNow communication about jobs/tasks to execute.

question: Which URL is not a valid IdentityNow URL assuming no vanity URL is in place?
What is the purpose of 'Desktop Password Reset'?

options.answer: It allows a user who has forgotten his/her Windows or Network password to access IdentityNow without authentication for the purpose of unlocking and resetting their Windows or Network password.

It allows a user who has forgotten his/her Windows or Network password to click a 'Forgot Password' button and activate a chatbot for the purpose of unlocking and resetting their Windows or Network password.

It allows a user who has forgotten his/her Windows or Network password to click a 'Forgot Password' button and they will receive a call from helpdesk for the purpose of unlocking and resetting their Network password.

It allows a user who has forgotten his/her Windows or Network password to access IdentityNow with secondary authentication for the purpose of unlocking and resetting their Windows or Network password.

question: What is the purpose of IQService?

options.answer: It is a native Linux service that enables IdentityNow to participate in a remote environment to access information only available through Linux commands and APIs.
It is an IdentityNow service that works with the VA to query the jobs queue and retrieve cloud access and internal financial information related to shadow IT operations.
Its purpose is to execute Powershell commands/scripts on a Windows environment to gather and report AWS, Azure, and GCP access information.
It is a native Windows service that enables IdentityNow to participate in a Windows environment and access information only available through Windows APIs.

question: Requestable Objects can be Entitlements, Access Profiles, Roles, and Apps.
How often will SailPoint release updates (Fixes, Patches, new Features) to IdentityNow?

options.answer: On the 15th and the 30th of every month
IdentityNow updates are ongoing and can occur multiple times per week.

question: What is the purpose of the Password Interceptor?

options.answer: To intercept the password when a user changes his/her password in IdentityNow and send this password to other target sources and clouds for distribution.
To intercept the password when a user changes his/her password on any system and send this password for distribution to other target sources and applications.
To intercept the password when a user changes his/her password in a remote location and send this password to IdentityNow for distribution to an access manager.
To intercept the password when a user changes his/her password in an application like Active Directory and send this password to IdentityNow for distribution to other target sources.

question: Multi-Tenant processing behavior can be described as:

options.answer: Administrators configure IdentityNow tenant to use a designated amount of processing resources.
Changes to individual microservices limit the risk of unintentional effects to other parts of the system.
Every IdentityNow tenant gets allocated the same amount of processing resources.
IdentityNow incorporates a fairness algorithm that determines how much each tenant can process relative to its size.

question: The Safety benefits of the IdentityNow Microservices are:

options.answer: Feature flags automate the deployment of existing functionality so new services or changes to a service can roll out to other parts of the system.
Feature flags couple new functionality so a new service or changes to a service can roll out to everyone in an organization.
Feature flags limit microservices risks from unintentional uses and missteps on other parts of the system and automated services.
Feature flags decouple the deployment of new functionality from its enablement so you can “try out” a new service or changes to a service.
